result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquette A Cain Allison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation may be transferred to the State of Indiana once her extradition case has been resolved.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

**Attend Thinking for a Change Course
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment, and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
(Agent to pay attention to any mental health treatment needs)
No contact with Buy Buy Baby and Monique Murrel. 
No dangerous weapons. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Straight-Time. 
45 days credit was granted. Commencing forthwith.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Luis Gutierrez advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 8:31 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Laquette A Cain Allison in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez. 
Case has already been disposed of.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 1:44 PM 
Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Laquette A Cain Allison in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
9 MONTHS JAIL
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
Probation may be transferred the State of Indiana once her Extradition case has been resolved.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
(Agent to pay attention to any mental health treatment needs)
No contact with:  Buy Buy Baby and Monique Murrel
Thinking for Change Course
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, pepper spray or OS spray, etc.)

RESTITUTION:  $SET AT ZERO
COSTS:  $268.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 3 Months Straight time.  Credit time 45-days.
Defendant is currently in custody in the Waukesha County Jail. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Body Armour warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
